page.title: 16MOFFAT;DISTRICT OR REGION?
page.content: In common with the rest of the British Isles 1974 saw a change in the pattern of local government.The Town Council,with the Provost as its figure head,and 10 members having total responsibility for town disappeared.In its place we have the present 3-tier set-up.{THE COMMUNITY COUNCIL}with 12 elected members but acting mainly as a pressure group.{THE DISTRICT COUNCIL} with 1 Moffat member,based in Annan and having control of Environment, Housing and Tourism.{THE REGIONAL {COUNCIL}in Dumfries having 1 district representative and wider powers in Roads&Transportation,Education etc. Many local people feel that local affairs are controlled from afar and that local interests would be better served had{COMMUNITY COUNCILS}more power.Many older people regret the passing of the{OFFICE OF PROVOST.
